availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Hopgood (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and wagon yard carpenter)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, wagon yard carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Ezra Hopgood. Married to Mary A. Cheaney Hopgood in Henderson County, Kentucky on June 22, 1852. Father of Minerva A. Hopgood, William L. Hopgood, Frances M. Hopgood, and Mary Hopgood. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Wagon yard carpenter in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 504B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 10.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson Ward 4, p. 147B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film #001944390, p. 135.
